context: A security incident involving command and control behavior was blocked. The incident revealed a corresponding URL `http://vectorsandarrows.com/` being associated with the alert. Additional investigations led to the detection of attempts to access Primary Refresh Token (PRT). The final alert in this sequence detected the execution of a known credential theft tool.
question: What was the command line for the detected credential theft tool?
solution_steps: A Command and Control behavior was blocked on the account with AadUserId `731adb71-b11c-4bbf-850b-57989b350e96`.
There was a possible attempt to access Primary Refresh Token (PRT) via the process `browsercore.exe`.
Another attempt to access Primary Refresh Token (PRT) was detected, involving the account with SID `S-5-7-21-1843151660-3234030288-105586167-1422`.

A known credential theft tool `mimikatz.exe` was executed with command line `mimikatz.exe privilege::debug sekurlsa::pth /user:fk8mq /ntlm: /domain:vnevado.alpineskihouse.co /run:..\notepad.exe //vnevado-jumpv cmd.exe` at `2024-06-20t09:03:04.6442161z` with Process ID `4464`.
